Package com.android

Class Animal

java.lang.Object
com.android.Animal
public final class Animal
extends Object
CREATING IMMUTABLE OBJECTS create objects that can be shared across multiple classes but do not want they're values modified you can copy the object and send it to a method, however this creates a large overhaed that you have duplicates of objects every time a method is called. Also this is not thread safe five rules 1...use a constructor to set all properties of the object 2...mark all of the instance variables private and final 3...don't define any setter methods 4...don't allow referenced mutable object to be modified or accessed directly 5...prevent method from being overriden Creating Immutable objects this class is Final so you cannot extend the class so this also means that none of the methods can be overriden (marking a class as final though does not mean you cannot change variables, the variables HAVE to be marked as final as well if you wish to achieve this) To see video tutorial for this section of code Video tutorial For all 177 videos, which cover all the topics in this course go to Complete Course Video Tutorial

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Animal​(String name, int age)
    constructor that takes a String and int cannot have a constructor that takes no arguments as this could lead to a object that has no value for name or age, and both these variables are final.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    int getAge()
    getter for int age,primitives are returned by value, so this is fine to return
    String getName()
    getter for String name,String is immutable class so it's fine to return the String
    String toString()
    toString method that prints out all details of Animal

  • Constructor Details

    • Animal

      Animal​(String name, int age)
      constructor that takes a String and int cannot have a constructor that takes no arguments as this could lead to a object that has no value for name or age, and both these variables are final. Java does NOT allow any code that could lead to circumstances where you could have a final with no value
